channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ New York University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: BAKU: An Efficient Transformer for Multi-Task Policy Learning
item.description: BAKU: A simple transformer enables efficient multi-task robot policy learning, achieving 91% success on real-world tasks with limited data.

item.title: Cambrian-1: A Fully Open, Vision-Centric Exploration of Multimodal LLMs
item.description: Cambrian-1: Open, vision-centric multimodal LLMs achieve state-of-the-art performance using a novel spatial vision aggregator and high-quality data.

item.title: DynaMo: In-Domain Dynamics Pretraining for Visuo-Motor Control
item.description: DynaMo: a novel self-supervised method significantly boosts visuo-motor control by learning in-domain dynamics from limited expert demonstrations, improving policy performance across various environme…

item.title: Explanations that reveal all through the deÔ¨Ånition of encoding
item.description: New method, STRIPE-X, powerfully detects ’encoding’ in AI explanations‚Äîa sneaky phenomenon where explanations predict outcomes better than their constituent parts alone would suggest.

item.title: Large Language Models Must Be Taught to Know What They Don‚Äôt Know
item.description: Teach LLMs uncertainty for reliable high-stakes predictions: Fine-tuning with graded examples significantly improves LLM’s uncertainty calibration and generalizes well.

item.title: Log-concave Sampling from a Convex Body with a Barrier: a Robust and Unified Dikin Walk
item.description: This paper introduces robust Dikin walks for log-concave sampling, achieving faster mixing times and lower iteration costs than existing methods, particularly for high-dimensional settings.

item.title: Non-convolutional graph neural networks.
item.description: RUM neural network, a novel non-convolutional GNN, overcomes limitations of conventional convolution-based models by using RNNs to merge topological and semantic features along random walks, achieving…

item.title: Preference Learning Algorithms Do Not Learn Preference Rankings
item.description: Despite common belief, state-of-the-art preference learning algorithms for LLMs achieve surprisingly low ranking accuracy, highlighting significant flaws in current alignment techniques.

item.title: Provable Posterior Sampling with Denoising Oracles via Tilted Transport
item.description: Boosting posterior sampling in challenging high-dimensional inverse problems, this paper introduces ’tilted transport’, a novel technique leveraging denoising oracles for provably easier sampling.

item.title: Reawakening knowledge: Anticipatory recovery from catastrophic interference via structured training
item.description: Overparameterized neural networks surprisingly recover from catastrophic interference when trained cyclically on repeated data sequences, exhibiting anticipatory knowledge reactivation.

item.title: Stochastic contextual bandits with graph feedback: from independence number to MAS number
item.description: Contextual bandits with graph feedback achieve near-optimal regret by leveraging a novel graph-theoretic quantity that interpolates between independence and maximum acyclic subgraph numbers, depending…

item.title: Unlocking Tokens as Data Points for Generalization Bounds on Larger Language Models
item.description: Unlocking tight generalization bounds for massive LLMs using a novel token-level approach.
